page.title: 11THE DEPUTY RANGER
page.content: Mr Wiseman is Deputy Head Ranger of Windsor Great Park. A qualified chartered surveyor, he employs 300 people to work on the Queen's 15000 acre estate, consisting of forest, park, gardens and farmland. He feels a personal responsibility towards all his tenants and employees. Mornings are often spent in the office, where accounts are kept on computer, answering letters, otherwise he is outside, seeing that all is well. His aim is to keep the park fit for the Royal Family to enjoy when they are at Windsor Castle. Much can be used by the general public tool He discusses new ideas with Prince Philip, the Head Ranger and each year he visits the Royal Show. He is so busy that he sometimes cannot manage to take his annual six weeks of holiday.
